entries.title: How to Bypass the UK BitChute Ban Using a VPN
entries.content:
The UKâ€™s recent BitChute ban has created significant disruption for users of the alternative video-sharing platform. Since April 10, 2025, UK residents have found themselves unable to view content on BitChute, prompting a remarkable surge in VPN usage across the country. This comprehensive guide explains why BitChute has been restricted in the UK, how VPNs can help you bypass these restrictions, and which services offer the most reliable solutions for regaining access while protecting your online privacy.

The BitChute Ban: What Actually Happened

BitChute, a platform known for hosting alternative viewpoints and content often removed from mainstream platforms, has effectively pulled out of the UK market due to regulatory pressures. According to the platformâ€™s official statement, the UK Online Safety Act of 2023 created an â€œopen-ended, unpredictable, and legally riskyâ€ environment that made continued operation in the UK untenable.

While UK users can still post content on BitChute, this content is no longer viewable by other UK users. Content posted by UK creators remains accessible to users outside the UK, who can interact with it normally. Essentially, BitChute has ceased functioning as a â€œuser-to-user video sharing serviceâ€ within the United Kingdom.

Why BitChute Made This Decision

The UK Online Safety Act gives Ofcom, the UKâ€™s communications regulator, unprecedented powers over content moderation and enforcement. These powers include the ability to impose significant penalties on platforms that fail to adequately protect users from potentially harmful content.

BitChute has historically positioned itself as a â€œfree speechâ€ platform, providing space for creators who may have been restricted on other platforms. However, this commitment to minimal content moderation conflicts directly with the UKâ€™s new regulatory framework, which demands proactive content filtering and removal.

Rather than fundamentally altering its approach to content moderation, BitChute chose to withdraw from the UK market entirely. This decision reflects a broader tension between government regulation and platforms committed to fewer content restrictions.

The VPN Solution: How UK Users Are Responding

In the days following BitChuteâ€™s announcement, search interest for â€œBitChute VPNâ€ surged by over 1000% according to Google Trends data. This dramatic spike demonstrates how quickly UK users have turned to Virtual Private Networks as a solution to bypass the restrictions.

VPNs work by encrypting your internet connection and routing it through servers located in different countries. When you connect to a VPN server outside the UK, websites and services (including BitChute) see your connection as coming from that country rather than from the UK. This effectively circumvents the geographic restrictions implemented by BitChute.

Why VPNs Are More Than Just a Workaround

Beyond simply helping you access BitChute, VPNs offer significant privacy and security benefits:

  • They encrypt your internet traffic, protecting it from potential surveillance by your internet service provider or other entities.

  • They mask your real IP address, making it more difficult for websites to track your online activities.

  • They provide protection when using public Wi-Fi networks by creating a secure, encrypted tunnel for your data.

  • They help prevent bandwidth throttling by your ISP, which can be particularly useful when streaming video content.

These additional benefits explain why many users continue using VPNs even when not specifically trying to bypass content restrictions.

Top VPN Recommendations for Accessing BitChute

When choosing a VPN to bypass the BitChute ban, youâ€™ll want to consider factors like server locations, connection speeds, security features, and ease of use. Here are three highly recommended options:

1. ExpressVPN: Premium Performance for Seamless Streaming

ExpressVPN stands out as a top-tier option for UK users looking to access BitChute. With servers in 105 countries, it offers exceptional flexibility for bypassing geographic restrictions. Key features include:

  • Consistently high speeds, which is crucial for buffer-free video streaming

  • User-friendly apps for all major platforms (Windows, macOS, iOS, Android, and more)

  • Military-grade encryption and a verified no-logs policy

  • Split tunneling that allows you to route some traffic through the VPN while accessing other services directly

  • 24/7 live chat support for quick resolution of any issues

While ExpressVPN comes at a premium price point, its reliability and performance justify the investment for users who value a seamless experience. It can even work as one of the best VPNs for China (Also See: ä¸­å›½å¥½ç”¨çš„VPNæ¨è). The service allows you to connect up to eight devices simultaneously, making it suitable for households where multiple people might need VPN access.

Â» Get ExpressVPN (4 month free)

2. NordVPN: Advanced Security with Extensive Server Network

NordVPN combines robust security features with an extensive global network, making it an excellent choice for accessing BitChute from the UK. Standout features include:

  • Over 5,000 servers across 60+ countries for reliable access

  • Double VPN feature that routes your traffic through two servers for enhanced privacy

  • CyberSec technology that blocks ads and protects against malware

  • Obfuscated servers designed to work in highly restricted environments

  • Independent security audits that verify their privacy practices

NordVPNâ€™s intuitive map interface makes it easy to select server locations, and their specialized servers cater to different needs, from extra security to optimized streaming. The service supports up to six simultaneous connections, providing good value for individuals or small households.

Â» Visit NordVPN (with discount)

3. Surfshark VPN: Unlimited Connections at an Affordable Price

Surfshark has rapidly gained popularity by offering premium features at a competitive price point. Many people consider it as a cheap VPN with great performance. For UK users seeking BitChute access, Surfshark provides:

  • Unlimited simultaneous connections from a single account

  • CleanWeb feature that blocks ads, trackers, and malware

  • Camouflage Mode that prevents even your ISP from detecting VPN usage

  • Servers in 100+ countries for reliable global access

  • NoBorders mode designed to work in restrictive regions

Surfsharkâ€™s unlimited device policy makes it particularly attractive for households or small businesses where multiple people need VPN sharing. While some users have reported occasional customer service challenges, the serviceâ€™s overall performance and value proposition remain strong.

Â» Visit Surfshark VPN (with discount)

How to Set Up a VPN to Access BitChute: Step-by-Step Guide

Setting up a VPN to bypass the BitChute ban is straightforward, even if youâ€™re new to using these services. Hereâ€™s a comprehensive guide:

1. Choosing and Installing Your VPN

  1. Select a provider: Choose from ExpressVPN, NordVPN, or Surfshark based on your specific needs and budget.

  2. Subscribe to the service: Visit the providerâ€™s website and select a subscription plan. Most VPNs offer monthly options, but youâ€™ll typically get better value with longer-term plans.

  3. Create an account: Enter your email address and payment information to create your account.

  4. Download the application: Once your account is created, download the appropriate app for your device. All three recommended VPNs offer apps for Windows, Mac, iOS, Android, and various other platforms.

  5. Install the application: Run the installer and follow the on-screen instructions. The process typically takes just a few minutes.

2. Connecting to the VPN and Accessing BitChute

  1. Launch the VPN application: Open the app and log in using your credentials.

  2. Select a server outside the UK: Choose a server location in a country where BitChute operates normally. Good options include:

    • United States

    • Germany

    • Netherlands

    • Canada

    • France

  3. Connect to the server: Click the connect button to establish your VPN connection. Most apps will show a notification when the connection is successful.

  4. Verify your connection: You can confirm your VPN is working by searching â€œwhat is my IPâ€ on Google or visiting specialized IP checking websites. Your displayed location should match the country of your chosen VPN server.

  5. Access BitChute: With your VPN connected, visit BitChute as you normally would. The platform should now be fully accessible, as youâ€™ll appear to be browsing from outside the UK.

4. Optimizing Your VPN Experience

For the best possible experience when streaming content from BitChute, consider these tips:

  • Choose servers geographically closer to the UK for faster connection speeds (e.g., France, Germany, or Netherlands rather than Australia or Japan).

  • Try different servers if you experience slow speeds or connection issues. Even within the same country, performance can vary between servers.

  • Use wired internet connections when possible, as they typically provide more stable performance than Wi-Fi.

  • Consider enabling split tunneling if available, routing only your BitChute traffic through the VPN while allowing other applications to connect directly.

  • Check your VPNâ€™s settings for options that might improve streaming performance, such as protocol selection or optimization settings.

Legal and Privacy Considerations When Using VPNs

While using VPNs to access BitChute and other content is currently legal in the UK, there are important considerations regarding privacy and security.

Legal Status of VPNs in the United Kingdom

VPNs are completely legal to use in the UK. There are no laws prohibiting British residents from using these services for enhancing their online privacy or accessing content available in other regions. Millions of UK residents use VPNs daily for legitimate purposes ranging from securing public Wi-Fi connections to protecting sensitive information.

However, itâ€™s important to understand that while the tool itself is legal, VPNs donâ€™t make illegal activities legal. They simply provide a layer of privacy and security for your online activities.

Choosing a Trustworthy VPN Provider

When selecting a VPN to bypass the BitChute ban, consider these privacy factors:

  • Logging policies: Choose providers with strict no-logs policies that have been independently audited. ExpressVPN, NordVPN, and Surfshark all claim to maintain no-logs policies, meaning they donâ€™t record or store information about your online activities.

  • Jurisdiction: Consider where the VPN company is based and what data retention laws they must comply with. Some jurisdictions have stronger privacy protections than others.

  • Transparency reports: Many reputable VPN providers publish regular transparency reports detailing any government requests for user data and how they responded.

  • Kill switch features: Ensure your chosen VPN offers a â€œkill switchâ€ that automatically blocks internet access if the VPN connection drops, preventing accidental exposure of your real IP address.

Alternatives to BitChute for UK Users

While VPNs offer an effective solution for accessing BitChute, some users might prefer exploring alternative platforms that arenâ€™t currently affected by UK restrictions. These include:

  • Rumble: A video platform that emphasizes creator freedom and has gained popularity as an alternative to mainstream video sites

  • Odysee: A blockchain-based video platform built on the LBRY protocol that emphasizes decentralization

  • DTube: A decentralized video platform built on blockchain technology with a focus on creator monetization

  • Brand New Tube: A UK-based platform that emerged as an alternative to YouTube, though its status under the Online Safety Act remains to be seen

Each of these platforms has its own content policies, user interface, and community. While none perfectly replicate BitChuteâ€™s specific offering, they may provide alternatives for users seeking content outside mainstream platforms.

Conclusion: Maintaining Access in a Changing Digital Landscape

The UKâ€™s BitChute ban underscores the growing clash between online content regulation and usersâ€™ demand for unrestricted access. While the Online Safety Act aims to create safer digital spaces, it has led BitChute to withdraw from the UK market, pushing many users to turn to VPNs as a practical way to regain access. VPNs like ExpressVPN, NordVPN, and Surfshark not only help bypass these restrictions but also enhance your online privacy and security.

As digital regulations continue to tighten, VPNs become essential tools for maintaining freedom online. Whether you want to access BitChute or simply protect your internet activity, using a trusted VPN empowers you to browse without limits and stay in control of your digital experience.

The post How to Bypass the UK BitChute Ban Using a VPN appeared first on VPNDada.

entries.title: ExpressVPN for China (2025): ExpressVPN China Testing & Review
entries.content:
Does ExpressVPN still work in China? Whatâ€™s ExpressVPNâ€™s China Link? We are VPN testers based in China. We tested ExpressVPN from China. Here are our test results and review of ExpressVPN:

Does ExpressVPN work wellÂ in China? This is our review of ExpressVPN based on real VPN tests done in China. In this review, we will cover Express VPNâ€™s speed, reliability, price, free trial, discount, software, customer service etc. to show whether ExpressVPN is a good for China. In addition to thisÂ ExpressVPN review, we have also testedÂ a number of other VPN services from China. If you are looking for a reliable VPN services to be used in China, Please alsoÂ read our list of Best VPNs for China.

ExpressVPN review in Chinese: ExpressVPNä¸­å›½è¯„æµ‹

Â» Get ExpressVPN (4 month free)

Pros:

  • ExpressVPN is not blocked in China

  • ExpressVPN responses very fast to Chinaâ€™s VPN blocking

  • Fast speed, reliable connections.

  • Many world-wide server locations to choose from.

  • Offers â€œConnection Per Appâ€ feature that allows bypassing VPN for certain apps.

  • With 30-day money-back guarantee, you can try it free for a longer time.

  • ExcellentÂ customer support.

Cons:

  • ExpressVPNâ€™s price is at the high end.

Starting Price: $4.99/mo (with discount offer from this link).

Free Trial: 30-day money-back

Simultaneous Connections: 8 devices.

Special Discount Offer:Â Get 4 Months Free from this link (with one-year plan)

ExpressVPN China Website (ExpressVPN China Link):

Â» Get ExpressVPN (4 month free)

About ExpressVPN

ExpressVPN is one of the big names of the VPN industry with world-wide customers. If you are looking for a reliable big brand VPN provider, you should definitely consider Express VPN. Below is a video about ExpressVPN:

Express VPN for China: Accessibility

Is ExpressVPN good for China? ExpressVPN has been listed as one of the best VPNs for China by many VPN reviewers. ExpressVPNâ€™s main domain, expressvpn.com, is currently blocked in China, but you might be able access ExpressVPNâ€™s website via this ExpressVPN China link.

Based on our tests from China, we confirm that users can sign up ExpressVPNâ€™s services from China and their VPNÂ service can be used in China.Â In addition to standard payment methods such as credit card and Paypal, Express VPNÂ also accepts Alipay and UnionPay, which isÂ convenient for customers in China.

Currently ExpressVPN doesnâ€™t support the Chinese language on their website orÂ software. Basic English skill is needed to use ExpressVPN from China.

ExpressVPN for China: Dealing with Chinaâ€™s VPN Blocking

China is known for blocking and disrupting VPN services. During certain periods, such as days before important political meetings, most major VPN services might become disrupted and VPN users might find great difficulty in connecting to VPN servers. ExpressVPN is not exceptional in this kind of situation. However, based on our observations, ExpressVPN isÂ usually more reliableÂ in â€œhard timesâ€ than other VPN providers (such as Astrill VPN).

For example, in late October 2018, a big attack happened to major VPN services in China. As a result, most VPN services, such as ExpressVPN, VyprVPN etc., experienced a short period of service disruption. Under such situations, some VPN companies would do nothing and just hoped for the best. However, ExpressVPN quickly acknowledged the situation and immediately started working on solutions. An email message was sent out to ExpressVPNâ€™s customers mentioning about the disruption along with a website link for ExpressVPNâ€™s China users to check on the latest status and download the latest software updates to deal with the blocking. With the updated software, released shortly after the disruption, many ExpressVPNâ€™s China users were able to use Express VPN again without any problem. This kind of quick response to Chinaâ€™s VPN blocking really makes ExpressVPN one of the best choices for Chinaâ€™s VPN users.

Â» Get ExpressVPN (4 month free)

ExpressVPN for China: Features

Server Locations:

ExpressVPN has servers in 160 locations from 105 countries with unlimited server switches. Actually, itâ€™s been rated as one of the best VPNs for Japan, Hong Kong and Taiwan etc. and can be used to access most blocked websites and services, such as Google, Twitter, Facebook, YouTube and ChatGPT. For VPN users in China, the best server choices for ExpressVPN are Hong Kong, Tokyo and Los Angeles (on ExpressVPNâ€™s desktop software, China users can see a list of recommended servers to connect).

Speed Limit & Bandwidth Limit:

ExpressVPN users can enjoy unlimited speed and unlimited bandwidth.

VPN Protocols:

ExpressVPNÂ offers multiple VPN protocol types includingÂ OpenVPN (TCP, UDP), L2TP-IPsec, SSTP, PPTP and Lightway. Based on our testings from China, for ExpressVPNâ€™s users in China, the best option for VPN protocol is to set it to â€œAutomaticâ€, which will allow ExpressVPN to automatically pick the protocol most appropriate for the userâ€™s network.

Supported Platforms:

ExpressVPNâ€™s users can connectÂ from computers, tablets and smartphones using their software or apps, which support Windows, Mac, IOS and Android.

Multi-Logins:

For simultaneous connections (or multi-logins), ExpressVPN allows users to connect from up to 8 devices at the same time.

Split Tunneling:

ExpressVPN also offers a feature called â€œConnection Per Appâ€ (split tunneling), which means you can choose which software/apps to use (or not to use) VPN when connected. This feature is very useful for users in China, because as most China users use ExpressVPN to unblock websites, itâ€™s not necessary to use VPN on local software/apps such as WeChat, Baidu Cloud, Aliwangwang etc. With this feature, you can let ExpressVPN bypass those software/apps to that their speed wonâ€™t be slowed down.

Logging:

ExpressVPN offers a no logging policy. Therefore, when you use ExpressVPN, your online activities are not logged and your privacy is protected.

NetFlix Support:

ExpressVPN can be used to bypass NetFlixâ€™s geo-blocking. With ExpressVPN, you can watch NetFlixâ€™s U.S. programs outside of the United States. Actually, ExpressVPN is one of the best VPNs for Netflix.

P2P, Torrenting & File Sharing:

ExpressVPN allows P2P and Torrenting.

VPN Traffic Identification:

Many VPNs can be used to bypass internet censorship, but when accessing blocked overseas services like Google Search or ChatGPT, the connection may be identified as VPN traffic. This requires cumbersome manual verification that you are not a robot. Furthermore, services like ChatGPT may refuse access if they detect a VPN connection. In this regard, ExpressVPN performs better than other mainstream VPN services. When connected to most ExpressVPN servers, the traffic is not identified as coming through a VPN. Google Search does not trigger captcha verifications, and ChatGPT access is not blocked when using a VPN.

Browser Extensions:

ExpressVPN recently started offering browser extensions, which can be installed to web browsers such as Chrome, FireFox and Safari. ExpressVPNâ€™s browser extension makes it easier to turn VPN on and off because the users can do so without leaving the browser.

Â» Get ExpressVPN (4 month free)

How to Get ExpressVPN in China

If you can see this page, itâ€™s most likely that you are either outside of China or you are using a VPN from China (because this website is blocked in China). If thatâ€™s the case, signing up for ExpressVPN is as easy as clicking on this link (special discount inside). However, for most internet users in China, as ExpressVPNâ€™s website is blocked in China, itâ€™s difficult to sign up for ExpressVPN. Donâ€™t worry, though â€” there are some ways to get around this problem:

  • Use mirrored websites. These are mirrors of ExpressVPNâ€™s website with different URL addresses that are not blocked in China. You can get a working mirrored link by emailing ExpressVPN or asking a friend outside China to chat with ExpressVPNâ€™s support and send you the link.

  • Ask a friend outside China to sign up for ExpressVPN for you. They can create an account for you, pay for the subscription, and send you the login details and installation files. You can pay them back through PayPal, bank transfer, or cryptocurrencies.

  • Use a free proxy or VPN to visit ExpressVPNâ€™s website. Free proxies and free VPNs are not reliable in the long run if you want to use them in China, as they are easily to be blocked. However, if you can find a free proxy or free VPN that are still working in China, you can use it as a temporary solution to visit ExpressVPNâ€™s blocked website in China and sign up the service.

  • (Android users) Email ExpressVPN and ask for the .apk app. If you have an ExpressVPN subscription and an Android device, you can install the .apk app without using the app store. Just contact ExpressVPNâ€™s email support and theyâ€™ll send you the .apk file for the latest Android app. Be careful not to download the .apk file from other sources because they might be harmful.

ExpressVPN for China: Price & Free Trial

ExpressVPN offers 3 plans: $12.95/month if you pay month by month; $6.67/month if you pay every 12 months and $4.99/month if you pay every 2 years. In addition to standard payment methods such as credit card and Paypal. ExpressVPNÂ offers a 30-day money-back guarantee, which is a much longer free trialÂ period compared to other VPN providers.

ExpressVPN for China: Desktop VPN Software

ExpressVPN offers desktop software for many platforms, including Windows, Mac, Linux, IOS, Android, Apple TV, Amazon Kindle Fire, PlayStation, Â Xbox Â and supported routers etc. In addition, installation instructions are provided for setting up ExpressVPN without installing their software for those platforms.

WeÂ downloaded their desktop client for Mac OS. The installation process was straight-forward and the software interface is clean and intuitive.

With theÂ desktop software, you can connect/disconnect to VPN and also change server locations and switch connection methods.

When the ExpressVPN software is running, an icon will stay on the menu bar (or called system tray on Windows), and it will indicate whether you are currently connected or not.

Â» Get ExpressVPN (4 month free)

ExpressVPN for China: Android App

For mobile phones running the Android operating system, ExpressVPN provides a free app that can be downloaded from the Google Play app store or by following a link to the APK installation file provided on ExpressVPNâ€™s website. We installed this app on a Android phone. This app has a very clean and easy-to-understand user interface. After logging in, you will see a list of servers for you to choose from, including a top recommendation server location, which is Hong Kong in our case. This app also allows users to run a ping test, which will estimate the distance between you and all ExpressVPN locations to help you choose a server closer to you. After connected to ExpressVPNâ€™s Hong Kong server, we were able to access blocked contents such as Twitter, Facebook and Youtube on our Android phone without any problem. We were able to play Youtube videos on this phone and the video streaming experience was very smooth.

ExpressVPN for China: iPhoneÂ App

ExpressVPN also provides a free App for iOS. We installed the ExpressVPN app from iPhoneâ€™s App Store. ExpressVPNâ€™s iPhone app looks different from its Android App. The iPhone app includes a map showing your current location and the VPN server locations. When you connect to a server, you will see an animated line connecting two dots on the map, which is pretty cool. We were able to connect to Express VPNâ€™s Hong Kong server. After the connection was established, a VPN icon appeared on top of the iPhone screen, indicating the connection success. With Express VPN connected, we were able to access blocked websites such as YouTube, Facebook and Twitter on our iPhone in China. When we played Youtube videos, the speed was very good.

Â» Get ExpressVPN (4 month free)

ExpressVPN for China: ExpressVPN Routers

ExpressVPN can also be setup on a compatible Wifi router. ExpressVPN even provides a VPN router app that can be installed on some supported router models. If you are interested, please read our ExpressVPN Router Review.

Express VPN for China: Customer Support

When you visit ExpressVPNâ€™sÂ website, you will see aÂ live chat box, which allows you to connect to a customer support representative directly round-the-clock. WeÂ tried chatting with ExpressVPNâ€™s support team on a number of occasions. Every time we wereÂ able to talk toÂ someone within one minute after I initiated the chat session, and their customer support representative seemed to quite helpful and know that they are doing. As a matter of fact, weÂ think ExpressVPNâ€™s customer support is probably one the best among the ones we have tested.

Â» Get ExpressVPN (4 month free)

Tips for Using ExpressVPN in China

  • Take advantage of ExpressVPNâ€™s 30-day money back guarantee. You can try ExpressVPN for free for 30 days. If it doesnâ€™t work or if you donâ€™t like it, you can cancel your subscription within 30 days to get a full refund.

  • For VPN protocol, choose the â€œautomaticâ€ option to let the ExpressVPN software to pick the best VPN protocol based on your current situation.

  • For VPN servers, choose the ones recommended by ExpressVPN. ExpressVPN has some dedicated servers that are optimized for China users. Those servers are usually located in Hong Kong, Japan or LA and are more stable during Chinaâ€™s VPN blocking. You can find a list of these servers when you open ExpressVPNâ€™s software, or you can contact ExpressVPNâ€™s customer support to ask.

  • Update your VPN software/app on a regular basis. To deal with Chinaâ€™s VPN blocking, ExpressVPN rolls out VPN software/app updates very often. You should always use the most updated version to make sure you can defeat Chinaâ€™s VPN blocking.

  • If your ExpressVPN connection is blocked, try the followings:

    • Make sure your software/app is the most updated version.

    • Make sure you are using the â€œautomaticâ€ protocol.

    • Switch to a difference server (choosing from from the list recommended by ExpressVPN).

    • Contact ExpressVPNâ€™s customer support via Live Chat or visit its support page for status updates and unblocking tips.

ExpressVPN for China: FAQs

Â Does ExpressVPN work in China?

The Great Firewall of China not only blocks foreign websites, but also blocks VPN services. As a result, most VPNs donâ€™t work in China. However, despite Chinaâ€™s heavy VPN blocking, ExpressVPN currently still work well in China.

Â How do I get ExpressVPN in China?

Due to Chinaâ€™s website blocking, the main website of ExpressVPN is blocked in China. ExpressVPN has set up some alternative domain names for users in China to access its service. Once you have signed up an ExpressVPN account, you can follow the instructions provided by ExpressVPN to set up VPN by installing its desktop software or mobile apps. You can also set up ExpressVPN manually on computers, mobile platforms and even Wifi routers.

Â How to get discount for ExpressVPN?

ExpressVPN has offered us a special discount, where you can get 3 extra months of ExpressVPN for FREEï¼ŒYou can click this â†’Â ExpressVPN discount linkÂ â† go get this special discount.

Â Why is ExpressVPN not working in China?

The Great Firewall of China has been trying to blocking all VPN services. Although ExpressVPN works most of the time in China, sometimes during heavy VPN blocking, it might stop working for a short period of time. When this happens, usually the ExpressVPN team is aware of this situation and can solve the problem and get it working again very soon. As a user, you should check ExpressVPNâ€™s announcement and also make sure to upgrade your software/app to the latest version. You can also contact ExpressVPNâ€™s live support to get your problem solved.

Â What if ExpressVPN canâ€™t be found in the Apple App Store in China?

Under pressure from the Chinese government, Apple removed almost all VPN apps from the Chinese version of its app store a few years ago. If youâ€™re using an iOS device, you can temporarily change the region of your Apple account to another country (e.g. USA), or temporarily switch to another Apple account belonging to another country, and download and install the ExpressVPN app. Then you can revert back to the original account.

Â Where can I download the ExpressVPN Android app in China?

ExpressVPNâ€™s Android app is not found in the Android App Store in mainland China, but you can install ExpressVPNâ€™s Android app by downloading the APK file directly from ExpressVPNâ€™s official website.

Â How many devices can ExpressVPN be used on at the same time?

When you purchase ExpressVPN, a single account allows you to use it on up to five devices at the same time (including computers, tablets, and other devices). If you still want to connect more devices, consider setting up ExpressVPN on your router (see our review for ExpressVPN router) so that all the devices connected to this router (unlimited number of them) can now all use ExpressVPN at the same time.

Express VPN for China: Review Conclusion

ExpressVPN is a well-known VPN provider and withÂ many customers. Users can sign up for their service from China and their VPN service work well in China. Their 30-day money-back guarantee offer is generous and their customer support is very fast and helpful. Among all VPN providers we have tested, ExpressVPN really stands out with reliable connections, fast speed and excellent customer supports, as well as quick responses to Chinaâ€™s ongoing VPN blocking. Based on our tests, we recommend this VPN provider and have included itÂ in ourÂ Best VPNs for ChinaÂ list.

Â» Get ExpressVPN (4 month free)

If you are looking for a reliable VPN services to be used in China, Please make sure to read our list of Best VPNs for China.
